event.name: START_RAD_SCIENCE
event.text: You have arrived in the sector belonging to the Scientists. The scientists keep to themselves, although there is a large civilian population who feel safe in their sector. The scientists in turn have started guarding their beacons against all who try to start trouble. We be fine if we keep out of the way.

event.name: GUARD_RAD_SCIENCE
event.text: The guard hails you. "Renegade, We understand your cause, but we cannot risk the disruption of the research or the lives of the people by letting you drag the rebellion through here, we want no part in it!"
You rush to defensive positions as the guard approaches menacingly.
You hope this is enough to satisfy them...
"Funny, I just can't seem to remember who gave me this scrap... Now hurry along before I change my mind."

choice.text: (Human Crew) Try to persuade them to let you go.
(Human Scientist) Have the scientist convince them to let you through.
(Mind Control) Convince the guard to leave you alone.
(Adv. Engines) Try to escape the guard.
(Adv. Piloting) Activate the auto-pilot to try and escape.

event.text: "I understand your cause, but if you do not leave I will be forced to make you leave!"
"I understand your cause, but if you do not leave I will be forced to make you leave!"
"Perhaps your cause is worth the risk, very well you may pass, we'll do our best to hold off the rebels."
"Ah, a fellow scientist, you may pass through if you'd like, but the rest of your crew cannont."
"Oh, my mistake, I didn't realise there was a fellow scientist on your ship, you may pass through."
"Oh, my mistake, I didn't realise there was a fellow scientist on your ship, you may pass through."

textList.name: RAD_SCIENCE_FREE_DRONES
textList.text: Nearby drifts the several discarded drones, they may not be functional however you're able to salvage a few drone parts from them.

You notice a mine drifting nearby, followed by several more. Most, if not all, are inactive, probably left over from some sort of training exercise. Fortunately, this means you can salvage them with relative ease.

A small craft appears on your scanners, it looks like it's coming straigh towards you. Your crew quickly moves into action and blasts it to pieces, you attempt to salvage it but the only thing that survived was a box of drone parts.

event.name: RAD_SCIENCE_SCIENTIST
event.text: You receive a hail from a small craft floating nearby, it appears to be one of the scientists.
"Ahh a fine ship you have there Captain, Would you consider taking me aboard?"
"Now I probably should have mentioned this, but some pirates want to kill me, I'm sure a strong capable Captain like you can deal with them though."
The scientist's small craft flies away, just as you think it's over you see a pirate ship fly right by you in pursuit.

event.name: GUARD_RAD_SCIENCE_DESTROY
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Whatever might have been in their cargo has for certain been destroyed, but you can at least salvage some supplies from the ship.

event.name: GUARD_RAD_SCIENCE_DEADCREW
event.text: You have defeated the Militia guard. Without crew on-board to stop you, you can investigate their cargo. You find a weapon to bring back to the ship, and move on to scrap their hull.

event.name: GUARD_RAD_SCIENCE_FOLLOWUP
event.text: By killing the Science Guard you've definently pissed someone off, lets just hope word doesn't travel fast.

escape.text: They look like they don't want to fight. They are trying to escape.

textList.name: TEXT_DESTROYED_RAD_SCIENCE
textList.text: As you harvest the remains of the Scientist's ship, it's clear their advanced technology isn't enough to save them from you.
The Scientist captain lets out one final expletive as the ship is obliterated.
The gleaming hull of the scientist ship fragments out into space. You swoop in to salvage the remains.
The ship explodes, extinguishing all lives within. Your crew avoids their remains as they salvage the ship pieces.
In a fury of sparks and explosions, the hull of the ship collapses. You quickly scrap the remains, which still seem to be in good quality.

textList.name: TEXT_DEAD_CREW_RAD_SCIENCE
textList.text: "Your bloodlust... will be your downfall someday, Renegade. You are only proof... the Federation... is no better than the Rebellion..."
"Man down, man down! Agh!" The crewmate's shouts go unheard as he is put down with the rest of his crew.
You've slaughtered the entirety of the crew. All that's left is to scrap their ship.
"To be fair... this was way above my... pay-grade..." The enemy captain clutches their heart and collapses.
"You will regret this! Karma always comes back to people like you. Damn you... Us scientists would have been better off without you renegades around..."

textList.name: TEXT_SURRENDER_RAD_SCIENCE
textList.text: "Please! Us Scientists are the only reason half the multiverse's technology exists, We invented the space waffle iron! You can't kill us!"
"Look, just let us live and we'll give you our stuff, that's what you renegades want right?"
The Scientist captain pleads with you to let them live. "Please, my family! They need me, I am their only source of income! I'll give you everything I can if you let me live!"

You receive a hail from another part of the ship, where another crew besides the captain speaks softly. "Please, if you stop firing I'll give you whatever is left in the cargo. Our captain is adamant, but the rest of the crew doesn't want to die!"
The Scientist ship is in tatters. You could probably negotiate their surrender at this point.

event.name: TRANSPORT_CAPTURE_RAD_SCIENCE
event.text: The crew is dead, leaving you with the ship. Its cargo is yours for the taking. Aboard is the special tech you expected, which you bring back to your ship.

event.name: RAD_SCIENCE_PIRATE_CAPTURE
event.text:
You clear out the defense cruiser and tow it back to the station, You're thanked and recieve a large amount of scrap as a reward.
One of the crew on the station offer to join your crew.
It turns out it's one of the soldier who was prevoisly stationed aboard the defense cruiser.
You turn down the offer, you don't need any new crew right now.

event.name: TRANSPORT_RAD_SCIENCE_LOOT

beaconType.visitedTooltip: Explored location. Nothing left of interest.

event.text: This beacon hosts a scientist transport. It's safe to bet the ship is most likely carrying some special tech. If you can kill its crew, their cargo will be yours.

choice.text: Demand the surrender of their goods.

event.text: You prepare to secure their cargo by force.
They stay outside your weapons range, and eventually jump away.
You power up the weapons and attack the Scientists.
You fly past the Scientist vessel.

textList.name: TEXT_RAD_SCIENCE_CHOICE
textList.text: A Scientist ship is surveying a planet in the area. No other ships are nearby.
You notice another ship, belonging to the Scientists, drifting some distance away. The ship is fully functional but politely declines any hails.
A decently armed Scientist vessel is patrolling the beacon, if you don't make any trouble they're unlikely to care about you.

event.name: RAD_SCIENCE_DEPOT
event.text: A nearby scienctist vessel is acting as a supply depot, they offer you a resupply.

choice.text: Submit your ID and get some supplies.
Attack, surely we can get more from them!

event.text: You power up the weapons and attack the Scientists.
You ignore the Scientists.

event.name: RAD_SCIENCE_PIRATE_CAPTURE
event.text: A nearby station is putting out a distress beacon, it appears that their defense cruiser has been stolen by pirates.

choice.text: Destroy or re-capture the defense cruiser.

event.text: You power up the weapons and attack the Pirates.

choice.text: (Upg. Cloaking) Cloak and scrap some of the station while they're defenseless.

event.text: With the defence cruiser stolen, there's no one around to guard the station. Under the veil of your cloak you tear off some of the plating and leave quickly.
You fly past the station. Hopefully, the situation will be resolved... no thanks to you.

event.name: MILITIA_COCKY_ZOLTAN
event.text: A flotilla of Zoltan vessels is present at this beacon - they seem to be performing training drills related to the endurance of their Super Shields. One ship among the group hails you: "Uh. Renegades, here? Not a common sight in Militia space. You know, you really stand out from the rest of the ships in this sector..."

"I mean, your cobbled-up and makeshift tech! Have you no shame, comparing your Federation to our orderly discipline and advanced shield technology? It's no wonder the Union calls for our help. This might be advertised as a 'joint effort', but it really falls upon us to give the local inhabitants safety, seeing as they fell behind on the technological spectrum."
Overhearing the conversation, the commander of the squadron pitches in to save face. "Quit pestering the Renegade. You have not yet seen what the rest of the galaxy has to offer. Such naivete could lead to your downfall!"

choice.text: Point out the inadequacies of the Super Shield.

event.text: You explain that their shield can easily be downed in a reasonable amount of time through specific weaponry fit for such, and throw in the fact that overconfidence, just like their famed Super Shield, cannot guarantee their safety from whatever the greater galaxy holds. Agitated by this comeback, the rookie defies orders to stand down, and attacks you! The commander pleads to avoid unnecessary bloodshed, but it looks like you'll have to make use of some force to discourage your attacker.
You proudly display your weapons to the Zoltan rookie, and they awestruck at the sight. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.
You proudly display your Artillery to the Zoltan rookie, and they awestruck at the sight. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Upg. Drone Control) Show that you're not so behind on the technological curve.

event.text: You proudly display your sophisticated drone technology, taking the rookie by surprise. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Energy Shield) Show that you're not so behind on the technological curve.

event.text: You proudly display your own Super Shield, taking the rookie by surprise. The commander thanks you for clearing the haughtiness of his subordinate and offers a reward.

choice.text: (Shield Bypass + Bomb) Demonstrate a gap in his protection. [-1}]

event.text: You teleport a payload right in their weapon system, taking the rookie by surprise. He promptly hails you - "Bah, we never expected you Renegades to be such... assholes!" The commander offers you a reward, supposedly for showing his men how to improve, but you suspect the real motive is to avoid any further escalation and get you to leave.

choice.text: (Shield Bypass + Teleport) Overtake his crew before they can respond.

event.text: You teleport a boarding party through and wipe them out with ease, showing that the haughtiness of the now dead rookie was unfounded. You begin to recover some scrap, but the commander rushes to the scene to stop you!

choice.text: Ignore the arrogant Zoltan and dedicate time to doing something else.

event.text: You didn't ask for anyone's opinion, so it's only fair to tune them out.

event.name: DISTRESS_RAD_SCIENCE_KERNELS
event.text: The source of the distress beacon appears to be an Orchid merchant under attack by a pirate vessel! Should we assist?
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
Orchid ships are considerably well armed, so you hope that they'll be able to save themselves.

event.name: RAD_SCIENCE_KERNELS_SAVE
event.text: The Orchids thank you for your assistance. They explain that they were sent to sell their Kernel weapons to the Militia vessels in this sector. As payment for your help, they offer one for free.

event.name: DISTRESS_RAD_SCIENCE_OUTPOST
event.text: The distress beacon's source is a small Militia outpost under attack by pirates. The Militiamen don't appear to be holding out well.
You power up the weapons and engage the pirate vessel.
"Hey, who the hell do you think you are- oh crap. Okay okay you win, have fun!" The pirate jumps away. The fatigued Militia station seems defenseless against anything you might try.
"Thank you, it was unlikely we'd have survived that pirate attack otherwise. We cannot offer much other than some fuel that we don't need."

choice.text: Demand they surrender one of their crew as a slave.

event.text: The Militiamen have few options but to give in to your demands.

choice.text: Destroy the station and loot the remains.

event.text: As you expected, the Militia outpost barely defends itself and is destroyed quickly.
You decide not to fight the pirates.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_RAD_SCIENCE_MISTAKE
textList.text: The wreckage of a civilian ship drift nearby, but before you can even think to salvage some of it, a Scientist ship mistakes you as the attacker and prepares to avenge the civilians.
You get into some trouble over your identification with the Scientist ship at this beacon, and not long after things get heated to the point of conflict!
The Scientists at this beacon seem to mistake one of your crew as an infamous pirate with a heavy bounty. Not about to hand over your crew, you prepare to fight.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_RAD_SCIENCE_STATION_MISTAKE
event.text: You run into a Scientist outpost near this beacon, who refuses to let you past. Apparently this beacon requires a toll to pass through.
The Scientists wastes no time with conversation - the second you refuse their weapons come online!
The Scientists collect the payment and allow you to continue.

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_RAD_SCIENCE
textList.text: It takes a bold pirate captain - or a stupid one - to try and take on the scientists space. When you notice the hostile ship approaching, you hope they're the latter as you prepare for combat.
A pirate vessel approaches, weapons already charging. They must be on quite the killing spree in this territory, and they're ready to take a break from Scientist and Civilian ships and fight yours!
Despite their advanced technology, it seems the scientists have been unable to completely wipe out the pirates. There's one heading straight towards your ship!
You catch the glimpse of purple fly past. Not long after, a pirate ship comes into view. "Haha! I have claimed the lives of many Civilians, and now I shall claim yours! Prepare to fight!"

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_PIRATE_RAD_SCIENCE_ONLY
textList.text: The Militia fleet boasts a large amount of ships, but this also makes them a prime target for pirates in need of a new ride. A pirate controlled Militia ship approaches, weapons blazing.
A pirate ship, looking to test out the new gear they just stole from the Militia, locks onto your ship and attacks!
At first you assume the ship here is just another ordinary Militia ship, until you see the pirate paint decorating its hull. Pirates inbound!

textList.name: TEXT_ENCOUNTER_REBEL_RAD_SCIENCE
textList.text: "The Rebellion shall never cease! All who ally with the Federation will be killed!" You doubt the moral superiority of murdering civilians only trying to protect their sectors, but if the Rebels want a fight, a fight they will get.

The Rebellion seem to hold a grudge against the Scientists, probably becuase they've lost their money at one too many Scientist Casinos. The Rebel ship here seems hell-bent on a fight, and since you're the only ship here they decide you will be a satisfactory opponent.
A Rebel ship has picked clean the remains of a Civilian station. Nearly seconds after you jump in they spot you and decide to make you their next target.

event.name: DESTROYED_RAD_SCIENCE_ELITE
event.text: You've managed to destroy one of the most dangerous ships in the sector, you scrap their ship and come out richer for it.

event.name: DEAD_CREW_RAD_SCIENCE_ELITE
event.text: As the last soldier falls, your crew begin scraping their ship. you leave their ship with bucket loads of scrap.

event.name: ENCOUNTER_RAD_SCIENCE_ELITE
event.text: The vessels of the Elite R&D Defense Force are some of the deadliest in the Scientist fleet, and for good reason. Boasting highly trained crew, these ships don't mess around in combat. Unfortunately for you, the ship here deems you a threat and attacks!
